intro: Rollandia lanceolata var. viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered lanceleaf rollandia, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green, with a prominent midrib. The flowers are notable for their vibrant green petals, which contrast beautifully with the foliage. This plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique coloration and foliage.
